stomacher was a type of underbodice in Faer√ªn, similar to a corset, that was worn by women overtop of gowns or other silken dress.
Stomachers were rigid garments that extended from crotch the wearers crotch to their breast. Many offered support for a wearers breasts as well as shaped panels for the hips. And stomachers that were made to cinch tight a wearers waist tight were particularly popular.
Waterdhavian stomachers often swept the sides of the bodice into fanciful swirls and gave off pointed shoulders.
* Larelda Shyrrhr Mallowdar designed and made stomachers among many other types of clothing in Deepingdale in the mid 14 century DR, until she was invited by Lord Piergeiron Paladinson to be a Lady of the Court in Waterdeep.
In the ancient past, stomachers could be found worn by elves in Cormanthyr and Myth Drannor.
In the mid-to-late 14 century DR, stomachers were a common element of fashion among younger Waterdhavian noble ladies. The stomachers worn by such women were of an open wire-work type, sporting elaborate filigree and designs, often set with gemstones.
In the , silver-laced stomachers were all the rage among Selgauntan noblewomen. Many wore them to the annual ball that was held on Hammer 30 in Stormweather Towers by Thamalon Uskevren to commemorate his lost brother. Notable wearers at the ball included members of House Uskevren, such as Shamur Uskevren wore a gold stomacher and her daughter Thazienne Uskevren who wore a bejeweled silver stomacher.
* Jhaniloth Puiral wore a stomacher.
* Laeral Silverhand wore a tight-waisted stomacher adorned with decorative elven interlacings of silverstar thread and studded with sapphires.
* Nasmaerae Felmorel wore a stomacher of intricately worked silver.
* Shairn Delarna once possessed an enameled, chased gold stomacher, until it was stolen by Talantra Bowgentle.
